channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Euro Rises After German Regional Inflation Data
item.description: The euro rose after German regional data showed headline inflation eased in September but core and services inflation remained sticky.

item.title: ‘I don’t want to spend my remaining days living hand to mouth’: I divorced my husband and remarried. Can I claim his Social Security?
item.description: “I hope that it doesn’t trigger my ex-husband. He has a short fuse.”

item.title: China’s stock market is closing just as investment outlook is brightening up
item.description: The Shanghai Stock Exchange will close from Oct. 1 to Oct. 7 for the China National Day celebrations. Hong Kong’s market will be shut on Oct. 1.

item.title: Nikkei's Message to Japan's New Leader: Higher Taxes Are Bad for Stocks
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average saw its largest tumble in eight weeks on fears of higher taxes under Japan’s incoming Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba.

item.title: ‘I’m horrified and heartbroken’: I gave my family cash gifts for summer. One person bought AR-15 rifles and handguns. What should I do?
item.description: “I always give money to close family members with kids to help pay for summer activities.”

item.title: Bond yields rise with key data on tap
item.description: Bond yields rose on Monday as traders prepared for a week with crucial economic data.

item.title: European Car Stocks Drop After Flurry of Guidance Cuts
item.description: European car stocks traded lower after Volkswagen, Jeep maker Stellantis and Aston Martin cut their respective annual outlooks.

item.title: Billionaire Snap CEO sells L.A. mansion after cutting $4 million off the price
item.description: Evan Spiegel can toast to another (semi) successful deal after finally securing a buyer for his Brentwood mansion.

item.title: China Markets Surge in Wild End to the Quarter
item.description: Some investors say what happens there could be key to global markets’ direction in the months ahead.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher on U.S. Rate Cut Expectations, Middle East Risks
item.description: Gold edged higher in early European trading, driven by optimism around further U.S. rate cuts and demand for safe-haven assets spurred by heightened g...
